TopicTitle: What to do if multiple mods have a gamedata folder?

Articles.Content: I just downloaded 3 mods, and all of them say to install their GameData folder. I can't have multiple GameData folders, though. How do I fix this?

25 minutes ago, nickrulercreator said:

I just downloaded 3 mods, and all of them say to install their GameData folder. I can't have multiple GameData folders, though. How do I fix this?

Most mods these days a packaged GameData/themod, never add a GameData folder to the GameData folder , as you surmise this would be bad,

Simply remove themod folder from the downloaded GameData folder and place themod folder in GameData

I should also mention that if you unzip and merge the downloaded GameData  folder into your KSP root directory( the main folder) that would also work properly

Edited January 17, 2017 by SpannerMonkey(smce)

On 17-1-2017 at 11:00 PM, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

Most mods these days a packaged GameData/themod, never add a GameData folder to the GameData folder , as you surmise this would be bad,

Simply remove themod folder from the downloaded GameData folder and place themod folder in GameData

I should also mention that if you unzip and merge the downloaded GameData  folder into your KSP root directory( the main folder) that would also work properly

 

Why is it bad? I do it for clarification to make clear they should put the content in the gamefolder

8 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:

Why is it bad? I do it for clarification to make clear they should put the content in the gamefolder

I wasn't saying that method of packaging was bad, I was saying that placing another Gamedata folder in the games  GameData folder is bad and will break things , for further clarification  anything that results in file paths like KSP/GameData/GameData/themod/  is what I'm referring to

Edited January 24, 2017 by SpannerMonkey(smce)
